## Variables

## Compare stepwise
```{r}
g.ex = dgm.group(ex)
g.fw = dgm.group(fw)
g.bw = dgm.group(bw)
g.bo = dgm.group(bo)

prc = array(NA,dim = c(1,3))
colnames(prc) = c("forward", "backward", "both")
prc[1] = (sum(g.ex$am==g.fw$am)-(Nn*N))/(Nn*(Nn-1)*N)
prc[2] = (sum(g.ex$am==g.bw$am)-(Nn*N))/(Nn*(Nn-1)*N)
prc[3] = (sum(g.ex$am==g.bo$am)-(Nn*N))/(Nn*(Nn-1)*N)
print(prc)
```

Stepwise both forward and backward combined is best and almost identical to exhaustive search.

### Compare stepwise
```{r}
N=500
Nn=10
prc = array(NA,dim = c(1,4))
colnames(prc) = c("run 1", "run 2", "run 3", "run 4")
prc[1] = (sum(dgm.net10.r1$am==dgm.net10.bo.r1$am)-(Nn*N))/(Nn*(Nn-1)*N)
prc[2] = (sum(dgm.net10.r2$am==dgm.net10.bo.r2$am)-(Nn*N))/(Nn*(Nn-1)*N)
prc[3] = (sum(dgm.net10.r3$am==dgm.net10.bo.r3$am)-(Nn*N))/(Nn*(Nn-1)*N)
prc[4] = (sum(dgm.net10.r4$am==dgm.net10.bo.r4$am)-(Nn*N))/(Nn*(Nn-1)*N)
print(prc)
```
